answers.answer: Sounds like it could be braxton hicks. Everyone is a little different. When I get them my stomach gets really hard, like there is a lot of pressure in there, and lasts maybe 30 seconds to a minute and then it eases and goes away. I wasn't sure what they were till my doctor witnessed it! :) But sounds like Braxton Hicks to me, and I am 27w2d.
i agree, sounds like braxton hicks. i get the same thing and the doctor said that is probaby what it is. so no worries, just your body preparing for what is to come. : )
But its ok it starting this early?  It doesn't hurt but it feels like a lot of pressure on my belly and chest.

It's probably BH, but I would call the doctor just in case.  I think its fine to start this early, that might have been when my started too.  When I was pregnant, I had a UTI 3 times!  Each time I had increased BH and felt pressure in my bottom, both from and back areas.  I never had chest problems though.  Also, each time I had a UTI my blood pressure was high when I was at the doctors.  That could be the case but the only way they can check that is through urine analysis.  Also, if you have high blood pressure a lot then that could be a sign of preeclampsia.  I had mild preeclampsia because as my pregnancy furthered my blood pressure kept getting higher each appointment.  I also had increased swelling and increased weight gain.  I was induced because of all that.  I'm not trying to scare you but just give you some insight as to what happened with me when I had high BP and the BH along with pressure.  But call your doctor or midwife to be sure.

I have an appointment next week, I think I can wait.My blood pressure has always been very low since the beginning of the pregnancy so I'm not very concerned about that.  When i'm having the contractions I just feel my chest tightening too but no pain maybe higher palpitations as if I was holding my breath but it only lasts like 30 seconds then its gone....

My BH started around 19 weeks actually. This is my second baby though, so they are known to start earlier, or be felt earlier anyways. If there is pain than I would get in to see a dr asap, but as long as there is no pain, I think all is well until your appointment. :)

I remember my BH starting at 21 weeks. My belly would get really hard and I couldn't catch my breath when it happened. They didn't happen very often, maybe a couple of times a week I would notice it, and they weren't painful at all. Sometimes I didn't even notice it happening unless I actually felt my belly. I think you are okay, as long as there is no pattern to them or they are not painful. Make sure to drink plenty of fluids too.

You actually have bh your whole pregnancy, but until your uterus is bigger you don't feel them. It sounds like that's what you're feeling. Chantal is right watch out for a pattern and be sure to drink lots of water.
Sounds like BH and like everyone else gave you great insight =)

Totally braxton hicks! Welcome to the club! I started to get mine at 18 weeks...next time you are at your doc's appt, ask to check your cervix, just to make sure it is closed :)They say drinking lots of water can help with BH, but mine didn't...so hang in there!
braxton hicks contractions actually start at about 6 wks! thing is we dont normally feel them till about 18-20wks its all normal! just another stage on the journey to motherhoodgood luck xx

question: Hello!This past week I've noticed that during the day my uterus gets really hard and I have a lot of pressure that makes it a little harder to breathe and I notice my blood pressure going up.  I'm 22 weeks pregnant, is this normal?  Are these braxton hicks, what is it?It doesn't hurt, it lasts for like 30 seconds and then its gone.....Baby is moving fine and moves throughout the day.
title: Belly pressure??
